1500169851423399938.text: We’ve made important progress in helping Americans get back to work over the past year, and I’m confident that these investments will create a stronger and more innovative workforce for decades to come.

1500135234645413894.text: So much of this disparity is a result of a lack of affordable childcare access, making the passage of cost-cutting measures for NJ’s families an even greater priority.

1500135233374593026.text: I am also still focused on supporting working moms as we emerge from the pandemic. Almost twice as many women have still not returned to work following job loss during the pandemic compared to men.

1500135232145707013.text: Job growth is strong and I’m working hard to relieve the inflationary pressures on families by addressing disruptions in our port system, trucking sector, and semiconductor industry.

1500135230962868227.text: The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is continuing these important investments and creating thousands of jobs in North Jersey through the completion of the Gateway Tunnel project and other critical infrastructure developments.

1500135229578743816.text: This progress highlights the importance of the investments in NJ’s workforce, families, and communities that have been made in the past year, including critical funds for our state and local governments and our education system.

1500135228169498628.text: New Jersey has also seen a robust jobs recovery. Our economy gained 134,000 new jobs in the 2nd half of last year, and unemployment has fallen from a pandemic high of 16.6% to just 4.9% in December.

1500135226848301060.text: Great news out yesterday that our economy created 678,000 jobs in February, the most since last July, and the unemployment rate fell to 3.8%, the lowest since the pandemic began! This continues our recent momentum, with 3.5 million jobs created in the past six months nationwide.

1491514462536413189.text: That’s why a new relief package, targeted at the small businesses most impacted by Omicron, is so critical right now. I won’t stop fighting until we get our communities the relief that they need.

1491514461206847494.text: As I’ve met with small business owners and local officials throughout NJ-11, all have expressed concern about the impact of Omicron on our economy and communities. I fear that, without additional assistance, many more businesses in North Jersey will be forced to close.

1491514459977916426.text: At the same time, Omicron has greatly impacted consumer demand for businesses centered on in-person gatherings, such as the @MayoCenter in Morristown and so many of our local restaurants, and has made it even more difficult for them to hire the workers they need.

1491514458723733516.text: The CARES Act and American Rescue Plan were so important during the pandemic in saving businesses across NJ-11, through  programs like the Paycheck Protection Program and Restaurant Revitalization Fund, but those crucial initiatives have now expired.

1491514457494855684.text: This week, I led ten of my colleagues in a letter to President Biden urging the Administration to support and help negotiate a new, targeted relief package to assist small businesses impacted by Omicron.

1490458082954166280.text: The COMPETES Act will reduce costs for NJ families & help our businesses better compete with China. I believe on the whole this bill will have a positive impact and I intend to continue working to improve the bill moving forward.

1490404282214010892.text: My methane mitigation amendment creates a grant program for states like NJ to offset energy costs for families. It also provides incentives for companies to accelerate and expand improvements to their natural gas distribution systems so we can reduce pollution in our communities.

1490404280674701319.text: NIST promotes innovation and competitiveness by advancing measurement science, standards, and tech in ways that enhance economic security. My amendment will strengthen their ability to develop and manage greenhouse gas emissions measurements, which will boost our competitiveness.

1490404279286444037.text: And, with that in mind, my amendment investing in long-duration energy storage technology will help us develop new and better ways to increase grid resiliency and reliability so we have less of the power outages North Jersey has come to expect.

1490404278011367431.text: NJ needs clean reliable electricity. To this end, I included a provision in this bill that would fund research for rooftop solar & reliable grid tech. We need to support energy innovation at home, not buy from China, to give Americans the affordable, renewable energy of tomorrow.

1490404276723716104.text: I was proud to work with @RepTimRyan and @NormaJTorres to ensure the bill creates an expert commission to address supply chain disruptions and establish a supply chain database for our manufacturing sector. These will help us to reduce supply chain problems and prices in NJ.

1490404275431874565.text: To combat inflation, I also authored an amendment to help critical supply chain sectors like the trucking and warehouse industries hire and train more workers quickly, by expanding access to our national apprenticeship system.

1490404274018390020.text: A top concern that I hear about in NJ-11 is rising prices and inflation. Because of this, I made sure the bill included an amendment requiring the Comptroller General to study and report on how this bill will help to reduce inflation and ensure that funds are spent responsibly.

1490404272663580674.text: To that end, after discussing these issues with my constituents, I secured inclusion of several amendments to improve this bill. These amendments focus on some of the most important issues to North Jersey families - cost of living and inflation, renewable energy, and jobs.

1490404271443095560.text: This bill is a strong step in the right direction. Moving forward, I remain committed to working to ensure the final version of this legislation does everything possible to lower costs for NJ families.

1490404270067400707.text: On Friday, I was proud to vote for the America COMPETES Act, which will help strengthen our supply chain and reduce inflation, increase our competitiveness with China, and bolster R&D initiatives that are critical to innovation and GDP growth.

1489713061015568397.text: Iran is one of the largest state sponsors of terrorism, has created insecurity throughout the Middle East, and presents an existential threat to Israel. I remain committed to ensuring the US takes appropriate diplomatic action to prevent a nuclear Iran.

1489713059186851841.text: This week’s Senate floor debate further illustrates the need for US efforts to ensure Iran does not have a path to developing nuclear weapons.

1489678771653419016.text: I am hopeful we can ensure a final bill continues to benefit American manufacturing, support workers throughout the nation, advance the clean energy economy, and help to end America’s dependency on key technologies like semiconductors.

1489678770403483658.text: I will continue to work to ensure the final version does everything possible to lower inflation for NJ families. I successfully secured passage of seven amendments to improve the legislation.

1489678769099087882.text: This bill will also increase our competitiveness with China, and fund the R&D initiatives that are so important to innovation, economic growth, and clean energy development in New Jersey.

1489678767903682568.text: COMPETES also aims to remedy the vulnerabilities in America’s supply chain that have often made us dependent on rival nations for key goods, and will bolster the size and skill level of our STEM workforce.

1489678766276235267.text: Today, we took a major step towards curbing inflation, stopping the rise in prices for goods like groceries and gas, and addressing disruptions in our supply chain by passing in the House the America COMPETES Act of 2022.https://t.co/MWDQZi6f1K

1481739151338782726.text: The right to vote and elect our own leaders is a sacred part of what it means to be an American, and this legislation demonstrates our commitment to uphold these ideals. I strongly urge the Senate to now pass this bill immediately.

1481739149984120835.text: This legislation takes steps to stop politicians that seek to interfere with or refuse to certify dutifully cast ballots by creating a new right to vote legal standard, preventing election officials from being removed for political reasons, and expanding protections for ballots.

1481739148662820869.text: This legislation will also bolster opportunities to vote by expanding early voting and vote-by-mail, end extreme gerrymandering by creating new neutral redistricting standards, and expand voter registration by increasing automatic, same-day, and online registration efforts.

1481739147408822277.text: The bill we passed today would create a new federal preclearance requirement that will ensure that states cannot pass election reforms that discriminate against certain Americans. That provision is the central component of the John Lewis Voting Rights Act.

1481739145970171911.text: It was the decision to strike down critical pieces of the Voting Rights Act in 2013 that has allowed these states to chip away at our democracy and has made it very difficult to fight against state voting laws that are riddled with discrimination.

1481739144648970246.text: As January 6 showed, democracy faces critical risks across the nation. The integrity of our elections is being endangered by officials in states who care more about partisan wins than preserving democracy & dozens of states have passed new laws restricting voting opportunities.

1481739142610489348.text: Today, the House voted on a major voting rights bill, which will protect the fundamental rights of Americans to vote and have their voices heard by enacting key provisions of the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Act. https://t.co/ZD76B0yJ7j

1479209185216712714.text: I have conflicting emotions about Jan 6. Yes, it marks one of the darkest days in our nation's history. 1479142408453599238.text: I’m a mom of four kids. I want them to have the same freedoms and protections, the same opportunities and say in their government that we have had. So today, as we commemorate and reflect, it’s their future that I’m thinking about most.

1479142407149178885.text: Today, as we remember what happened, our focus should be on what we can and need to do to ensure an attack like that never happens again. It’s our duty now to do everything in our power to safeguard our American values and freedoms.

1479142405827973120.text: January 6 marked a dark day in our democracy. But it does not and will not define us.

1479142404481560579.text: I could have never imagined living up to that oath would one day mean protecting our democracy from fellow Americans or a former president who sought to undermine our elections in an attempt to stay in power.

1479142403097432065.text: When I repeated those words, the images of the Nazis my grandfather fought during World War II or the armies of the Soviet Union I saw growing up during the Cold War were the ones that populated my mind.

1479142401713352711.text: That oath bestows the responsibility to support and defend the Constitution of the United States against all enemies, foreign or domestic.

1479142400215891970.text: I’ve taken that oath many times. The first when I was 18 years old entering the US Naval Academy, excited and proud to serve our nation. Since then, I’ve taken it throughout my Naval career, at the US Attorney’s Office, and, now, as your Congresswoman.

1479142398794027010.text:
Today, I want to share some reflections I have on the one year anniversary of that attack.

On that day, and in the year after it, my mind turned to two things: my family and my oath to the Constitution.

1479142397359632385.text: On January 6, 2021, I stood in the House Gallery as an angry mob, sent by the President of the United States, stormed the Capitol building with the intention of preventing Congress from carrying out the will of the people and certifying our election.

1461753433233444865.text: With childcare, reducing prescription drug costs, and repealing the SALT cap, this legislation will bring costs down and improve the quality of life for our New Jersey families. I urge the Senate to follow our lead.

1461753431870291975.text: It also helps our seniors by creating a new out of pocket cap on what they must pay for their medications.

1461753430175887366.text: I have a constituent who travels to Canada for her sister’s insulin. I have heard too many times about how this basic, life-saving drug has been bankrupting families.

1461753428808450049.text: It provides NJ families with relief from sky-high costs. It will ensure nobody pays more than $35 a month for insulin, which can run New Jersey residents anywhere from $1,200 to $20,000 a year.

1461753427281813511.text: There were times when I was paying MORE than I earned in childcare. This bill will address our workforce issue by ensuring our working parents can afford (and find!) quality childcare and get back to their jobs!

1461753425742516228.text: I’m also a mom of four kids and believe me, childcare has been a debacle. I hear from couples who are teachers and paying nearly half of their income on childcare costs.

1461753424463151112.text: During the pandemic, almost 1.8 million women dropped out of the workforce, many of them due to childcare and school closures.

1461753423024562176.text: I hear you Maureen! That’s why every time Sen. Sanders removed SALT from the bill, I insisted we add it back in.

1461753421598498819.text: For years, I’ve heard from constituents like Maureen. She says, “We love living in this area but we are basically working to pay taxes. The cap on SALT has wiped out our savings and taken money away from my children for college.”

1461753420143112192.text: This bill also lowers the cost of prescription drugs, the cost of childcare for working parents, and, thanks to the repeal of the SALT cap, includes a tax cut for middle class families in NJ-11.

1461753418473775108.text: I ran for Congress on a pledge to lift the cap on state and local tax deductions – on SALT. This morning, I voted to do just that. This is such a huge win for North Jersey as I continue to work to make our state more affordable for families.

1458551377337192450.text: In NJ, they will transform our transit network, create thousands of good-paying jobs, jumpstart the clean energy economy, and save thousands of lives through cleaner air and water. If that return on investment for our communities doesn’t make sense, I don’t know what would.

1458551375969890313.text: Together, these investments will bring US infrastructure into the 21st century and help make us competitive with the rest of the world.

1458551374644396032.text: The bill also modernizes and expands our port system to respond to the critical supply chain issues we currently face, provides access to high-speed broadband to millions of families, and expands our public transit networks.

1458551373348360192.text: By building a nationwide network of electric vehicle chargers & turning the nation’s school bus fleet electric, we will boost R&D and innovation, reduce emissions, & save thousands of lives through cleaner air.

1458551371741941775.text: But the bill doesn’t just fix existing things. The package also Invests in growing our economy for the future and expanding our clean energy economy.

1458551370127220738.text: .@ENERGY found a return of almost 4:1 from investments in the grid, through improved reliability, reduced blackouts, and better energy efficiency.

1458551368764084227.text: Whether it’s an ice storm in Ogdensburg or wind and thunderstorms in Pequannock, some part of the 11th district is without power for weeks at a time throughout the year. Looking forward to investments that ensure clean, reliable power for NJ!

1458551367363137543.text: We will also modernize and harden our power grid while expanding renewable energy transmission and storage. As you all know - across northern New Jersey, issues with our grid routinely lead to disruptive blackouts.

1458551365748338691.text: Evidence suggests that these contaminants worsen our health and children’s educational achievement, and new data estimates that investments to remove them produce a return of 2:1 in public health and economic benefits.

1458551364368441352.text: But this bill delivers a lot more for NJ communities - namely, clean drinking water!!! With it, we will modernize our water infrastructure and eliminate PFAS and lead in our water supply.

1458551363009400836.text: This funding won’t just reduce the risk of shutdowns, but will save billions for commuters and our state as we reduce congestion on the roads and improve the efficiency of the daily commute.

1458551361721806851.text: Funding for Gateway is a centerpiece of the bill and of central importance for our economy and our climate.

1458551360178294786.text: In our state - the most densely populated in the nation - cars are the major source of carbon emissions.  Making sure people have an efficient commute on our electrified railways is the best way to cut down on our car usage in northern NJ.

1458551357896630281.text: The failures in this tunnel have led to lost wages, missed kids’ soccer games, and minimized productivity for the hundreds of thousands of commuters on our rail system each day.

1458551356483063812.text: The Gateway Project. That’s right, after years of work, enduring constant “infrastructure weeks” in the administration with no actual investments in infrastructure, we have now funded the nation’s most critical infrastructure project.  No more summers of hell, New Jersey!

1458551355136778246.text: Let’s run through some of the biggest wins for New Jersey included in this bill. Thread:

1458551353400348681.text: For decades, we have relied upon Eisenhower-era infrastructure to support our economy. In NJ, this has meant crumbling bridges & tunnels as well as an outdated water system & electric grid. The Bipartisan Infrastructure & Jobs bill will reverse that & transform NJ’s economy.

1448644516781625351.text: In response to these ongoing crises facing vets, in honor of our veterans who have given so much, & w/ gratitude to Vet Center counselors nationwide, I introduced the bipartisan Vet CENTERS for Mental Health Act, which will increase the number of Vet Centers across this country.

1448644514768306179.text: Despite the high-quality care Vet Centers provide, not everyone has access and far too many of our veterans nationwide continue to suffer mental health issues and all too often fall victim to drug abuse, homelessness, suicide or other ills as a result of a this lack of care.

1448644512516083713.text: While the Bloomfield Vet Center is doing a great job serving our communities, the case load they are experiencing is immense, especially in the wake of the pandemic. North Jersey needs an additional center to help address this.

1448644507898023942.text: Vet Centers are often seen as the gold standard in mental health care for these veterans. In August I was honored to visit the staff at the Bloomfield Vet Center to meet with the mental health professionals who care for those who have served and hear them discuss their work. https://t.co/ha1tMdUriZ

1448644496929918983.text: Since that time the Vet Center mission has expanded to include support for veterans who were victims of military sexual assault, bereavement services, and services for our national guard and reservists.

1448644494874882050.text: In 1979, in the wake of the Vietnam war, the VA stood up Veteran Centers for mental health counseling.  These institutions were uniquely designed to support veterans who faced the trauma of combat, as well as offer aid and support to their families.

1448644493566164995.text: At the end of last week, I introduced a bipartisan bill that would expand one of the key parts of our VA health system that routinely offers lifesaving mental health aid to our nation’s veterans and address the critical need for it here in North Jersey. 🧵

1448072907431755779.text: Tonight, the House voted on a standalone bill to raise the debt ceiling, taking one of the last steps needed to ensure we protect the full faith and credit of the United States. That is a critical piece of our job, and it should never have become a partisan issue.

1446612508282916869.text: Each of these components plays a role and that’s the message I delivered to the Vice President when she was here today.

1446612506848468997.text: Whether it’s SALT, the Gateway tunnel, growing the clean energy economy, or making childcare affordable for families -- delivering these packages is urgent because New Jersey’s middle class families need these investments now.

1446612505372016643.text: This legislation gives us the opportunity to make the investments that will jumpstart our economy, create millions of jobs, and keep our nation competitive with other countries around the world. We need to make these investments for our communities and our economy as a whole.

1446612503761391616.text: Today, I reiterated that I’m not willing to renege on that promise. We must address the deduction cap in the reconciliation bill.

1446612502691913728.text: That’s why I’ve been fighting to repeal the SALT cap since I first entered office. This has been a promise we made to the people of New Jersey and states like it.

1446612501089632256.text: SALT helps our state to fund the best public schools in the nation, our first responders, and critical infrastructure.

1446612499785293830.text: The SALT deduction cap is a crucial cost of living issue for my constituents. It’s about affordability and ensuring that teachers, firefighters, and public servants aren’t getting taxed twice. 54% of families in my district took the deduction before the 2017 tax law was enacted.

1443665881297559552.text: Joined @CNN this morning to discuss the importance of passing the infrastructure bill today, so we can get to work on critical projects like the Gateway Tunnel. https://t.co/3SLGg7ge72

1443375548944818176.text: If we don’t act now, millions of jobs will be destroyed and costs for all American families will be significantly raised. That’s what’s at stake here. The partisan games need to stop and we need to get this done now.

1443375547795574794.text: The debt ceiling shouldn’t be a partisan issue. Congress voted to raise the debt ceiling three times under former President Trump. And going back to 1960, Congress has raised the debt ceiling 49 times under Republican Presidents and 29 times under Democratic Presidents.

1443375546688286722.text: It would cause interest rates to rise across the board - forcing taxpayers to shoulder increased borrowing costs, homeowners to pay more on their mortgages, and consumers to pay more on their credit card bills.

1443375545648099333.text: A default would also call into question just how trustworthy of a borrower the US is.

1443375544444334083.text: If we don’t raise the ceiling, we won’t be able to pay back our loans and will default on our debt -- with major impacts on job growth and families’ savings. Moody’s estimates that this default would destroy 6 million jobs and wipe out $15 trillion in household wealth.

1443375543051825155.text: Raising the ceiling doesn’t authorize new spending at all - but instead allows the government to finance our existing obligations that both parties have made over the past two years.

1443375541076234248.text: Today, the House voted again to raise the debt ceiling to ensure that the U.S. government doesn’t suffer a devastating default on our existing debt. Such a default could cost millions of jobs and wipe out trillions in families’ savings.

1436765178067144710.text: This morning, I joined residents at the Eagle Rock Reservation 9/11 Memorial to commemorate all those lost. @SenBooker, @SenatorMenendez, @Joe_D_EssexExec, @RepDonaldPayne, @LtGovOliver, elected officials, & clergy gathered at the same site where so many saw the towers fall. https://t.co/sqB0npLW7t

1436754734765969415.text: My team and I are joining towns across #NJ11 to commemorate this anniversary. After the year and half we’ve had, we’re grateful for the opportunity to gather in-person on the anniversary of 9/11 to remember and honor our families, friends, and neighbors. Follow along.

1436754732626894853.text: We’ll also never forget our troops who lost their lives overseas in the fight to ensure a terrorist attack like 9/11 never happens again.

1436754730772992004.text: We’ll never forget those we lost in the towers, at the Pentagon, and on Flight 93. We’ll never forget the first responders from New York, New Jersey, and those who flooded in from all over the country to save lives and recover our loved ones from the rubble.

1436754728441028608.text: Today, we solemnly mark the 20th anniversary of the 9/11 attacks. We lost 749 New Jerseyans that day. Many more in the intervening decades due to illness caused by exposure to toxins around Ground Zero. Each year we recommit ourselves to the promise we made to never forget.

1436455920062668814.text:

1436136916781617155.text: This crisis impacts all families and all parents. It’s not just a women’s issue. It’s a quality of life issue, it’s an economic issue, and -- as we work to rebuild our economy -- it’s an employment issue.

1436136915426856961.text: In today's @EdLaborCmte mark up, I offered my amendment that makes the investments to ensure that *all* families pay no more than 7% of their income on childcare, & am so pleased that this bill funds the expansion of the number of childcare spots available to families.

1436136913778380804.text: With this budget we’re going to be fixing that with big investments in childcare that will help bring down the costs for families who are struggling with this crisis.

1436136912289415169.text: These exits from the workforce, even if temporary, can have a large impact on the long-term earnings of women. Researchers have found that women taking just one year off work had, over a 15-year period, up to 40% lower earnings than those not taking time off.

1436136569954517008.text: We know that 1.8 million women, including over 1 million mothers, dropped out of the workforce as a result of COVID-19, many of whom haven’t been able to re-enter. Last month, women accounted for only 12% of the new jobs that were created nationwide.

1436136294376222721.text: As a working mom, I know first-hand how difficult it can be to secure childcare. Affordable childcare is essential to ensuring a strong economic recovery and overcoming our workforce shortages. https://t.co/PPhmMyK5j8

1434984621104680965.text: This Labor Day and all year long, I am proud to be the granddaughter of a union man and a fiercely pro-labor member of Congress!

1434984616629317632.text: Whether it’s the 9-to-5 work day or the weekend, we have our nation’s labor movement to thank for the protections we all enjoy. But the fight for working families is ongoing. In Congress, we’re working hard to protect and expand workers rights for everyone.

1434984614783766534.text: This Labor Day, I’m thinking about how unions built the middle class, helping families like mine prosper. My grandfather was a member of the @UAW working on the factory floor of GM. With his union job, he supported his 8 kids, even helping some attend college.

1431662783721005065.text:
If we’re going to recover from the economic fallout of this pandemic, get people back to work, & build an economy that’s better than before, we need both.

Let’s get it done! 💪(14/14)

1431662782626377732.text: All in all, these investments are about creating jobs, growing small businesses, & keeping us competitive with the rest of the world. (13/x)

1431662781238026241.text:
Plus, the reconciliation package includes significant tax cuts for working families largely through the Child Tax Credit. 

This middle class tax cut is putting money back in families pockets & will go a long way in keeping NJ affordable & reducing child poverty by 50%. (12/x)

1431662780055236613.text:
The reconciliation package also builds on our efforts to boost our clean energy economy.

Whether it’s growing electric vehicle infrastructure, modernizing the grid, or expanding wind & solar - these investments are going to create good (often union!) jobs here at home. (11/x)

1431662778784358406.text:
The investments there will help Americans reenter the workforce & gain the skills they need.

We need to make sure that we’re giving both businesses & working families the resources needed to create jobs & fuel our economic recovery. 

This package will do just that. (10/x)

1431662777542787073.text:
Additionally, on small business walks all year, I’ve heard about the challenges our businesses face in finding the workers needed to successfully reopen.

Reconciliation legislation will include crucial funding to expand child care access & workforce development programs. (9/x)

1431662776364244994.text: In reconciliation, we have good indication the package will finally deliver SALT deduction cap relief for our middle class families. 1431662775051370496.text:
That's in addition to investments in clean drinking water infrastructure, grid resiliency, electric vehicle infrastructure, research and development, & roads, bridges, and tunnels.

We need these investments to keep our communities competitive as we head into the future. (7/x)

1431662771410804740.text: The bipartisan infrastructure package makes a number of crucial investments, including in passenger rail, which will provide much of the financing needed to complete the Gateway Tunnel Project. (4/x)

1415031544108961796.text: I’m proud to be fighting to bring this critical money back to the district and keep these projects moving through the appropriations process so we can improve the infrastructure, affordable housing, mental health, and childcare sector of the #NJ11.

1415031420414832640.text: @WestOrangeInfo would utilize the funding for the expansion of Degnan Park’s existing amenities & enhancement of the site for ADA accessibility. The project will provide recreation equipment for low impact fitness for seniors to help improve fitness & decrease loneliness.

1415031037122461702.text: New Jersey’s early education and care sector was crushed by the pandemic, seeing a loss of 71% of family child care providers. With this federal funding, @UnitedWayNNJ’s project United in Care would work to repair this incredible loss.

1415030749103857666.text: Totowa’s funding would be used to buy and install poles and new LED lights for the football field and Lincoln 90 baseball field at the @TotowaPal Fields complex. This project will help provide a safe outdoor recreation space for all Totowa residents.

1415030508686385162.text: The Stanhope Water Main Replacement Project would replace undersized water mains, which are 70 years old, at risk for breakage, and create public safety concerns with respect to fire emergency response.

1415030327991488516.text: The Peckman River project would receive funding for the @USACEHQ to begin the Preconstruction Engineering and Design (PED) phase of their project. This would help to mitigate the significant flooding the region has endured over the last several decades.

1415030055160406020.text: Morris Plains’s funding would go towards new sidewalks and crosswalks, a pedestrian overpass, intersection improvement, and traffic signal optimization. This will provide safe pedestrian access to public transportation for families living in nearby affordable housing.

1415029788868231176.text: @MorrisHabitat4's funding would be used for the construction of twenty-five affordable homes and a community room at 42 Bennett Avenue in Randolph. This is one of Morris Habitat's biggest projects to date!

1415029624946536454.text: @MHAEssexMorris’s funding would be used for Suicide Prevention Services, which are designed to provide presentations on suicide prevention for schools. These services can also be provided to the greater community, including parents, family members, houses of worship, & colleges.

1415029085831585800.text: The @HopatcongBoro PFAS Water System project would install above-ground vessels, which filter well water in order to reduce PFAS levels. PFAS are a significant public health threat and have been linked to adverse health effects.

1415028872047906817.text: The @Bloomfield_nj Lead Service Line Replacement Program would fulfill a need to identify & replace lead pipes that have exceeded their usefulness & risk contaminating residents drinking water w/ harmful toxins.

1415028315036000258.text: I was thrilled to see the @AppropsDems Committee approve all ten of my Community Project Funding Requests. Each of these projects will make a lasting impact on the lives, livelihoods, and resilience of the communities they serve in #NJ11.

1410974334357807104.text:
There have been a lot of questions about the Unidentified Aerial Phenomena (aka “UFO’s!”) that aviators have been encountering.  

I’ve received a classified briefing this week and it’s exciting to hear the DOD is working to better gather information.

1410674767401787393.text: As a member of the Higher Education and Workforce Investment Subcommittee, I am proud to introduce the Expanding Pathways to Employment Act today to help aid America’s re-employment efforts by funding these proven workforce initiatives.

1410674699017805826.text: We must learn from this as we continue to rebuild after the economic fallout caused by the COVID-19 pandemic and support workforce development programs with proven results.

1410674660266680321.text: After the Great Recession, many unemployed Americans struggled to recover as a result of difficulties finding jobs in the fields they were previously employed in. The ability of these workers to move into new jobs & industries could’ve been the key to a faster economic recovery.

1410667532789469187.text: At one point, America set the world standard in infrastructure. But for the past half a century, we’ve been resting on Eisenhower era investments and we’ve paid the price for not ensuring our infrastructure can keep up with our economy. It’s time we make those investments now!

1410667439327744000.text: Today, I voted for the INVEST in America Act, which reauthorizes surface transportation programs through 2025, including key steps to advance the Gateway Project, improve commuting and passenger rail across NJ, & fund several projects right in #NJ11. https://t.co/GnCnCbbLdr

1395770571535884289.text: I joined Morning Joe yesterday to speak about HR 3233, which creates a bipartisan, independent commission to investigate January 6, the worst attack on our nation’s Capitol & an attack incited by the former president. https://t.co/aP3YIw3TbS

1395157829309304834.text: Without it, our country won’t be able to heal. This commission will help. Today’s vote was a step in the right direction. The next one is ensuring we get this bill to the president’s desk to be signed into law.

1395157751345655808.text: The attacks of January 6 are a symptom of a much deeper problem and the House Republicans who voted against this commission are a part of it. The American people deserve a comprehensive accounting of the threat & a plan that addresses how we as a nation can move forward.

1395157662715858946.text: I stood in the House gallery as the mob broke into the Capitol building. There’s no doubt their intent was to undermine our democracy and do harm to those who would uphold it.

1395157621364215809.text: It’s a sad day when these Members can’t even stand to support an independent, bipartisan commission focused on the truth.

1395157441898221571.text: Today, the House passed H.R. 3233 to establish a commission to address the attack on the Capitol on 1/6 and how we got there as a nation. The vote was bipartisan, but far too many of my Republican colleagues still opposed it.

1395127353869803520.text:
As a veteran, former federal prosecutor, & now Congresswoman, I’ve taken the oath of office many times. 

Each time it’s meaningful & powerful. 

Opposing a bipartisan, independent commission to examine the events of January 6th betrays the commitments we make in that oath.

1395089101657972737.text: Today, I rose on the House floor to speak about why it’s so crucial we establish an independent, bipartisan commission to examine the attack on the Capitol on January 6th. https://t.co/85w7oxNfl5

1395084107755950082.text:
It also is the perfect example of why we need to establish this commission & take an unflinching look at that day, investigate the security failures & what led to this act of domestic terrorism. 

Without it, we won’t be able to move forward as a nation.

1395084106849980417.text:
House Republicans ousted Liz Cheney from leadership partly because she refused to sweep the events of 1/6 under the rug. 

Their attempt to whitewash an attack on our democracy and prioritize loyalty to Donald Trump’s “Big Lie” over loyalty to the nation is a disgrace.

1395084105918857225.text:
Later today, the House will be voting on H.R. 3233, which would create a *bipartisan*, *independent* commission to examine the attack on the Capitol on 1/6. 

I strongly urge my colleagues to vote in favor of this legislation for the sake of our nation.

1394792640818909187.text: This legislation directs the DOJ to do a thorough review and investigation of hate crimes committed against Asian Americans in the wake of the pandemic, to bring justice to those harmed. This bill is now heading to the president’s desk to become law.

1394792616319983624.text: Throughout the pandemic, we saw a disturbing rise in racist rhetoric and hate crimes against Asian Americans. This violence cannot go unchecked. That is why today I voted for the bicameral COVID-19 Hate Crimes Act.

1394395018945781763.text: It is time we come together to recognize the disparate effect of this provision. The New Jersey middle class cannot take another year of this cap. Let’s repeal it before the next #TaxDay.

1394394976549736450.text: I have advocated against the SALT cap since my first day in office. During my first term, I spoke on the floor for twelve days straight and was able to secure a repeal of this double tax in the House right before the end of the year.

1394394932916494337.text: The bottom line is: it's not millionaires being crushed by this double tax. It’s teachers and cops. It’s seniors and veterans. It’s middle-class families who are getting taxed twice. In the wake of the pandemic, we need relief from this unfair cap now.

1394394870790377474.text: It’s #TaxDay and it is the third year in a row New Jersey residents have been impacted by the harmful SALT deduction cap imposed by the 2017 tax bill.

1392826593916112896.text: In 2021, there is no excuse for lack of or inequitable health care for our women vets. I urge my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to stand up for all the moms serving and send this bill to the president’s desk to become law.

1392826550651957249.text: This legislation would establish a maternity care coordination program either at the VA or in conjunction with community care providers for mothers who served. It also includes measures to address the maternal mortality crisis, especially among women of color.

1392826518104072197.text: Whether they’re active duty, reservists, or now veterans -- moms have served this country well. It is time Congress empowered the VA to be able to provide maternal health care to our female service members. That is why I am supporting the Protecting Moms Who Served Act.

1380230318410625028.text: As more time passes, the importance of remembrance grows. That’s one of the many reasons why I introduced a bill last term that establishes a study abroad program to further Holocaust and WWII education. We teach about these atrocities to stop history from ever repeating itself.

1380230296155611137.text: Today on #YomHaShoah, we remember the 6 million Jewish people who were murdered in the Holocaust and reaffirm our shared duty to fight against antisemitism today.

1379891306718228491.text: Squeezed in a caucus call on Zoom in the car (as a passenger!) ride back from discussing the American Rescue Plan with small business owners and local officials across #NJ11. It was great to have @SecYellen join us to talk about the admin’s plans to keep working towards recovery. https://t.co/HejpuIfCIL

1379886234093428742.text: At its core, the ARP is an important investment that most economists agree will get our economy back to full employment faster and ensure that our hardest-hit businesses have the support they need to recover from this crisis.

1379886169350148097.text: The tough economic situation we’re facing is the reason I was so proud to support and vote for the #AmericanRescuePlan, which will jumpstart our economic recovery from this crisis.

1379886147430707202.text: @MorrisChamberNJ has worked hard to support its members as we’ve seen the impact the pandemic has had on business throughout our communities, both large and small.

Supporting small businesses checklist:

1379502861810302978.text: Dr. Iacono and his team provided a fantastic overview of this impressive new resource focused on building the pipeline of workers with the advanced manufacturing skills that our local companies need to thrive here in Morris County and NJ, and creating great job opportunities.

1379495013801938945.text: Access to affordable childcare is critical to keeping women in the workforce. Supporting places like the Lakeland Hills Family YMCA means supporting working parents throughout our community.

1379494941198589954.text: It is estimated that almost 1.6 million mothers have left the workforce due to COVID-related school closures and the labor force participation rate of mothers with school-age children fell by almost 5 percentage points when the first wave of school closures hit the country.

1379494675615248395.text: The ARP provides an additional $39 billion in relief funding for the child care sector, for a total of $50 billion across all of the coronavirus relief bills. This means an estimated $695 million in childcare related relief coming to New Jersey from the ARP!

1379494546921435140.text: I sat down w/ CEO Alex Martinez, Associate ED Marianne Lomauro, Mountain Lakes Mayor Tom Menard & Deputy Mayor Lauren Barnett to discuss the Y’s community programs, how they reopened childcare programs safely, & how the #AmericanRescuePlan supports childcare & school reopenings.

1379494434119766018.text: I toured the @LHFYMCA to talk about providing critical childcare and community services to families throughout @MorrisCountyNJ and about how the Lakeland Hills Y serves more than 10,000 families in towns across #NJ11. https://t.co/OMxFV8cliG

1374826950867451905.text: As we look towards economic recovery after the pandemic, we need to focus on how we’re building an economy that works for working women.

1374826880780632076.text: This past year was particularly hard. Women bore the brunt of the economic fallout of pandemic, overwhelmingly shouldered the burden of child care as schools shut down, and risked their lives as frontline workers.

1374826725322936330.text: Women in #NJ11 who work full time make on average around $20K less than men. That wage gap only widens for women of color.

1374826663545016332.text: On #EqualPayDay, we must recognize the wage gap isn’t just a women's issue, it’s an economic issue, a family issue, and an equity issue.

1374813486291767299.text: We cannot let veterans get needlessly locked out of using their hard-won benefits because of a global pandemic out of their control. It’s crucial that the VA Secretary be empowered to preserve those benefits by pausing the time-limit on the GI Bill.

1374813365432901636.text: The GI Bill is one of the most transformational programs offered to our veterans. @RepMMM & I introduced the bipartisan GI Bill NEED Act to protect veterans’ educational benefits from expiring due to institutional closures or other factors caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Funding for state & local gov'ts is crucial to combat the pandemic, create jobs & invest in the next generation. I proudly led the bipartisan SMART Act w/ @SenatorMenendez to deliver this assistance & urge funding to be included in the next package.
https://t.co/OSNqDS3ZZ0

1340092012310216705.text: The absence of federal aid to states and localities is a threat to law enforcement budgets right now. State & local spending on public safety fell from 2010-2012 as those governments faced severe budget crises, and the same could happen again without federal support.

1340092011160940544.text:
From 2008 to 2013, state and local governments cut their investments in programs to support children, and the same is likely to occur now in the absence of new federal support.
https://t.co/Oq6i5TR63A

1340092009697206273.text: Without federal support, they will also have to make damaging cuts to long-term investments that benefit us all, including K-12 education, law enforcement, and anti-poverty programs.

1340092008250130433.text: Beyond jobs, state & local gov'ts are at the forefront of combating the pandemic & poverty. They are funding testing sites, running food banks & supporting businesses w/ emergency assistance. With their funds from the CARES Act used up, they will have to pull back these efforts.

1340092006299820033.text: Research published in the NYT also finds that of the 40 cities facing revenue declines in FY 21 of over 4%, 17 are in states with 2 Democratic Senators, 16 are in states with 2 Republican Senators, and 7 are in states with Senators from both parties. https://t.co/38UYbCQpGq

1340092005259554819.text: This job loss is not a blue state or red state issue, but an American issue. Since February, government employment has fallen by 46k in New York and 28k in New Jersey, but also by 49k in Texas and 42k in Florida.

1340092004093583363.text:
Since February, state and local governments have cut over 1.3 million jobs as the pandemic has caused their revenues to fall steeply. This accounts for almost 15% of the jobs that have been lost and still not recovered since the pandemic hit.
https://t.co/djJf6Sopva

1340092002503942147.text: During the Great Recession and its aftermath, a lack of support for state and local governments cost over 700k jobs and was an important factor in our slow recovery. I worry that we are making this same mistake today. https://t.co/oFS8YEpLqK

1334886822695067648.text:
Is this going to solve everything? No.

But is this a good step we can take now? Absolutely.

We can provide immediate aid now, and then work with President-elect Biden on future relief measures.

1334886821885566976.text: By January, we could see 3,000 deaths a day and hundreds of thousands of new job losses as a result of COVID-19. We cannot afford to wait.

1334886821042544641.text: The CDC’s eviction moratorium ends on December 31, which could spark a major homelessness crisis unless we act. This framework sets aside $25 billion for housing assistance to help ensure that families can stay in their homes.

1334886820069433344.text: Retail sales and restaurant demand have also begun to fall as a result of the case surge, threatening millions of small businesses. This proposal will provide $300 billion in funding for PPP and will allow businesses to apply for a 2nd PPP loan. https://t.co/Kk2WDrczZo

1334886819041857537.text:
The closure of schools is further weighing on jobs as parents are forced to leave the labor force, and there is also evidence that kids’ learning is being harmed. This framework provides $80 billion to help schools reopen safely.
https://t.co/ssien5Oz9b

1334886818051993600.text: The employment recovery has also begun to stagnate as job growth slows, and we have still not recouped 10M lost jobs. This proposal extends UI benefits that expire on Dec. 31 and creates a $300/wk benefit, ensuring that the unemployed have some extra help. https://t.co/jsJN0Kay9K

1334886817082998784.text: With much of the current funding for states and localities to combat the virus expiring on December 31, this framework provides them with $160 billion in critical aid, alongside $50 billion for healthcare and testing.

1334886816072290306.text:
The health crisis continues to worsen, and more than 100,000 Americans are now hospitalized with COVID-19. 
https://t.co/7f4xgUQeHQ

1334886815061471237.text: I proudly supported the HEROES Act. Twice. But as I said then, we need a bipartisan compromise that can become law and help the American people. 1334886814059028481.text:
I’m encouraged to see this bipartisan, bicameral compromise framework. I urge my colleagues to continue to work together along these lines to provide desperately needed relief to Americans. 
https://t.co/tF8UT2OiR4

1326658106030514177.text: Patrick shouldn’t have had to fight the VA for care. And neither should any of our veterans. It’s time to pass H.R. 8261 and ensure that we uphold our commitment to our service members.

1326657969744973824.text:
I’m thinking of the tragic loss of New Jersey's Patrick Duva, who died last week.

“His family said VA medical staff told Duva that his cancer was related to the toxic exposure he experienced during his military service, but VA ‘wouldn't document it.’”

https://t.co/NB94y6IbMi

1326657816803897344.text: That’s why I’m proud to co-sponsor @RepRaulRuizMD’s bill, H.R. 8261, the Presumptive Benefits for War Fights Exposed to Burn Pits & Other Toxins Act, which would strengthen benefits for veterans suffering from burn pit related illnesses and est. presumption for overseas service.

1326657583130742789.text: But that still leaves an important issue unresolved: presumption. Just like with the 9/11 VCF, we need to ensure that any veteran who developed these health issues and served near burn pits is guaranteed care.

1326657318608637953.text: And the House has passed my amendment this summer to increase funding for research at the Airborne Hazards and Burn Pits Center of Excellence in East Orange, NJ. https://t.co/7yBeoaH2hj

1326657317568454656.text: 2️⃣ It directs DoD to provide to the VA and Congress a list of all locations where DoD used burn pits, for the purposes of research, healthcare delivery, and disability compensation.

1326657316515684354.text:
Last year, the National Defense Authorization Act included 2 provisions to address burn pits:

1️⃣It requires any periodic health assessments for service members to include an evaluation of whether they were stationed near burn pits and/or were exposed to toxic airborne chemicals;

1326657314422722560.text: One of the first meetings I ever had in Congress was with @Burnpit360, Jon Stewart, and John Feal to talk about how we can do better and learn from the 9/11 VCF and their work to help those exposed to the toxic fumes from Ground Zero. I promised we would not let this go. https://t.co/D4yePHN52u

1326657310354235393.text: Burn pits have been called the Agent Orange of our generation. And that’s what it is looking like unless we stand up for our veterans and demand better.

1326657309318254602.text: In fact, as of September of this year, the VA denied 78 PERCENT of disability claims from burn pits: https://t.co/FfqPPYbYdI

1326657308177428482.text:
The VA has a Burn Pits Registry to document exposure and health concerns, but still maintains that research “does not show evidence of long-term health problems from exposure to burn pits.”

https://t.co/8keS89Fw6d

1326657307124658184.text: Watch this CBS piece for an important overview of the use of burn pits and the impact on our veterans: https://t.co/rFF0FFJIeY

1326657305899839492.text: Too many of our veterans have been exposed to harmful chemicals from burn pits, which we know lead to increased risk of lung and respiratory diseases.

1326657304738091009.text: Burn pits were used in Iraq and Afghanistan to get rid of waste — and by waste, I mean everything — from batteries, to plastics, to jet fuel. And as of last year, nine were still in use across the Middle East.

1326657303605616643.text: 🧵 This #VeteransDay, I want to renew the call for comprehensive action to address burn pits and the serious, lasting health impact their use has had on a generation of veterans.

1245323662334537728.text: I will continue to work with stakeholders at all levels of government to help our state and our country. 7/

1245323661596295168.text: My military training taught me that an Army marches on its stomach — that our supply lines are essential to success in the field. We must have a national plan for PPE, and coordinated purchasing, production, and procurement that comes from the federal government. 6/

1245323660946288644.text: More federal government support would also help local manufacturers mitigate risk as they look to re-tool their factories to help increase PPE and ventilator production here at home. 5/

1245323660262617088.text: I advocated again for a rigorous implementation of the #DefenseProductionAct. Increased supply chain support from the federal government will help us make sure areas that are at the epicenter of this crisis get the equipment and gear they need. 4/

1245323659494985729.text: I had some good news from the Director: He told me they are focused on how to turn key medical equipment over to the states as quickly as possible. This is vital for New Jersey — we have the second highest number of COVID-19 cases in the country. 3/

1245323658672762880.text: I talked about the importance of getting additional personal protective equipment (PPE) and ventilators to NJ. I told him about my calls every morning with our local healthcare providers, and their concerns about protecting personnel and expanding intensive care capacity. 2/

1245323657737637888.text: Spoke yesterday with the Acting Director of the Strategic National Stockpile to advocate for New Jersey and the critical need for key medical equipment for our healthcare systems, nursing homes, and first responders on the front lines in our state. 1/

1150555546698813441.text: I have called out the President on his racist remarks in the past and will continue to do so. Racist remarks are never acceptable and are even worse when they are attacks on sitting Congresswomen and are an attempt to undermine our democracy.

1150555544354283520.text: But I have fought to defend our country, our values, and our Constitution for many years now. There is something very wrong when the President of the United States is the person attacking our American values and our democratic system.

1150555542504595456.text: I often do not respond to inflammatory comments posted on the web. We have too much to do to constantly become enmeshed in petty squabbles when so many people need affordable healthcare and a better future.

1149783085866717184.text: To watch my full floor speech, click here: https://t.co/lxNskk0e0N

1149764933523005441.text:
9/11 First Responders were there when our country needed them most. It's about time that we were there for them.

1149415468266086407.text: Young people like Keyonna and Arianna are why I voted for increased appropriations for @NIH and @NIDDKgov, which both fund research into treatments for Type 1 Diabetes, and why I will continue to work to strengthen the Affordable Care Act. 4/4 https://t.co/3ZyEHzcXPI

1149415450935222272.text: The cost of treatment forces young people like Arianna to choose: medication or education. No American should have to make that decision. We need coverage that is quality and affordable. Lives depend on it. 3/4 https://t.co/gTA0CIfY9O

1149415436716597249.text: Their stories are just another reminder of why we need to protect the Affordable Care Act — so young people like Keyonna and Arianna are able to stay on their parents' insurance and no longer face discrimination due to a pre-existing condition such as diabetes. 2/4 https://t.co/LS5iUZVgRy

1149415419691884544.text: Keyonna and Arianna, young women with Type 1 Diabetes, visited yesterday and advocated for more funding for T1D research. I am so moved by their determination and courage. I'm posting a few pages of a scrapbook they gave me documenting what life with T1D looks like. 1/4 https://t.co/575tfLf8IE

1147522662106898432.text:
The tradition of reading the Declaration on the Morristown Green gives us the opportunity to reflect on the document, revisit our founding, and remember the work we still need to do to live up to our principles.

Here are my full remarks from the 4th: https://t.co/C01xsJ5vHv

1147312004664832002.text: Congratulations to the Yogi Divine Society on the Grand Opening of Haridham Mandir New Jersey. It was an honor to share in your wonderful celebration! https://t.co/jonRAHteUf

1146866009715990529.text: These principles were radical for their time. In fact, the Declaration was not guaranteed. It was a struggle — and it was earned. Each generation must take these words to heart and seek to perfect our union.

1146864606662582272.text: Thomas Jefferson wrote, “we mutually pledge to each other our Lives, our Fortunes, and our sacred honor.” We are bound to each other as Americans. We honor individualism, but must remember that lifting each other up is critical to our success as a whole.

1146862271001497600.text: I was honored to give the remarks at the traditional Reading of the #DeclarationOfIndependence on the Morristown Green. As I said today, the Declaration is both a reminder of what we have achieved, and a challenge to build a better future for the generations of Americans to come. https://t.co/iYXmUaYh4q
